title: Error Handling at Local Level
description: All data or state issues must be handled at the lowest, most local level possible and never thrown as exceptions.
rules: Use local error handling and recovery mechanisms
Never let exceptions bubble up to user-facing layers
enforcementMechanisms: Static code analysis for exception handling patterns
Code review focus on error handling strategies
examples: Using try-catch blocks with local recovery logic
Implementing fallback mechanisms when primary operations fail
Logging detailed error information for debugging while showing user-friendly messages
Using circuit breakers to prevent cascading failures
Implementing exponential backoff for retry operations
exceptions: Critical system errors that require immediate attention
Security-related exceptions that need special handling
